paragraph.paragraph: EiffelEnvision projects are compatible with Visual Studio .NET Source Code Control (SCC) packages such ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/guides/html/vsoriVisualSourceSafe60.htmVisual Source Safe. There are multiple ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/guides/html/vstskVersion_Control.htmSCC plug-in's for Visual Studio .NET, each with their own abilities and tailored functionality.

When integrating EiffelEnvision projects into a SCC repository not every project item will be integrated. ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/guides/html/vstskVersion_Control.htmSCC is bound to a project's physical location. For EiffelEnvision projects, this means, eiffelenvision_projects/structure/eiffel_libraries/eiffel_libraries.xmlEiffel Libraries will not be integrated using SCC. This is because most eiffelenvision_projects/structure/eiffel_libraries/eiffel_libraries.xmlEiffel Libraries are not located in the project's location but are instead located in some arbitrary location outside of the project. Well formed eiffelenvision_projects/structure/project.xmlProjects will have all of their eiffelenvision_projects/structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/items/index.xmlProject Items integrated into a SCC repository and none of the eiffelenvision_projects/structure/eiffel_libraries/eiffel_libraries.xmlEiffel Libraries.

To add a project into a SCC repository, see ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/sccvs70/html/veoriAddingSolutionsProjectsToSourceCodeControl.htmAdding Solutions and Projects to Source Control.

To get started on using the facilities and functionality provided by SCC faction of Visual Studio .NET, see the documentation installed with your SCC compatible Visual Studio .NET plug-in. For user of Visual Source Safe, see ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/guides/html/vstskUsing_VSS.htmUsing Visual Source Safe.
